poem:
**High Wire**

Between the knicker racks and tinned peas,  
Archie walks his line, no safety net,  
a hundred years of wool and beeswax  
balanced beneath bright store lights.  
Forty percent up, he juggles numbers –   
a miracle priced in parsnips and pants –  
no pats on backs, just hands clasped  
on the wire, wobbling toward tomorrow.
